justification: “N-back tasks are considered the gold standard measure of working memory (Jacola et al., 2014).”
The paper states that “Cognitive load was measured in the task dimension (mental workload) through both the maximum N-back level achieved (Walter and Bex, 2021).”
Methods note that cognitive load was also assessed via “maximum pupil dilation (van Rij et al., 2019; Zhang and Cui, 2024).”
For the person-based dimension, cognitive load was measured “through NASA Task Load Index (NASA-TLX) (Hart and Staveland, 1988).”
The authors explain that they “used the User Experience Questionnaire (UEQ) at the trial's conclusion to identify potential issues related to the round's collaboration method (Schrepp et al., 2014).”
